website_summaries.verdict: A capable, micro-cut paper shredder with a dedicated feed slot for credit cards and CDs.
pros: It can operate for up to 5 minutes at a time and it features an array of LED lights that communicate the machine's current status at a glance
The unit can be switched from auto-feed to manual-feed mode, if desired
cons: This machine works best when shredding less than the maximum number of pages it can handle

customer_reviews.title: Caught on fire.
customer_reviews.text: After about 6 months of use and shredding a minute or so of junk mail, I left the room and smelled something burning. When I returned I saw the plastic on the top melted. In the future I will opt for the more expense high quality one to have that fire safety piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a good shredder. I found this one claiming it shredded ...
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good shredder. I found this one claiming it shredded paper to micro-cut size, and I gave it a try. It's AMAZING! I am very careful with all the paperwork that has personal information and this machine rocks. I am attaching a picture of the size of the final result- all the shreds are very small, and the blue pieces in the picture was a debit card, which got completely destroyed! It's quiet, very compact, the size is perfect. Worth every penny, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Works great!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a couple of months now, and use it almost daily to shred the junk mail with our address. It is a little less noisy than the smaller shredder I have (also Amazon Basics) which is currently on my husband’s office. This one has a larger bin and since the shredded compartment opens like a drawer, you don’t get bit of paper everywhere when emptying it. I use a medium trash bag to line the shredded compartment so its easier and less messier to empty and replace with an empty bag.
customer_reviews.author: VivianC

customer_reviews.title: Good for lightweight use, not for purging!
customer_reviews.text: This shredder, after one year, can only handle one piece of paper at a time, and even then, it sounds like the shredder is going to die before it finishes shredding the one page. My use is heavy as I have been shredding thousands of pages, two at a time, for the last year. Shredding at this pace is very time-consuming! The shredder overheats when the barrel is full, and I have to remove the accumulated shreddings from the teeth frequently. I would not recommend this shredder for someone who has a lot of paper to shred; instead, invest in a better quality machine that will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kim H

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after approximately 8 uses
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this shredder. I purchased it several months ago to shred regular bills and invoices at home. I've used it approximately 8 times since purchase and it stopped working! It will go in reverse but not forward. No, there is no jam. I've only been able to shred 4 plain sheets of paper at most to begin with. Unfortunately it's past the return window so now I have to see if I can get any resolve from the warranty service. I doubt it. I will never purchase another amazon shredder.
customer_reviews.author: SewNovice

customer_reviews.title: Not a 6 page shredder, Don't expect much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another Amazon shredder that had lasted several years. I typically just shredded junk mail, sometimes 5 or six pages thick. I liked the new one because it was much quieter. I realized immediately that the new one couldn't handle anything more than 3 or 4 pages at a time. I started shredding old financial documents, realizing that it didn't have much staying power, I only did 3 pages at a time. After a few minutes it started smelling and sub sequentially the overheating light came on and it stopped working. The next day I tried doing only one page at a time, it lasted about 8 minutes before overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shred the machin not paper.
customer_reviews.text: disappointed after reading really good reviews. Not only was this one of the loudest machines I have ever used, but when feeding 6 sheets it sounded like a old diesel truck: straining at it's load. Returned it almost immediately. Good idea-Lousy result
customer_reviews.author: Responder

customer_reviews.title: NO BULL HERE!
customer_reviews.text: After Buying CHEAP Shredders for my office over the years I've learned Don't go cheap. This shredder is a delight to have. I was surprised how VERY quite it is. Works perfectly. Actually it's the best one if ever bought. The basket is so easy to work with when emptying it. No messes like others I've bought. If you need a small office shredder this one is worth every penny. It chops credit cards no problem. It is a bit slow but does a great job. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: just poor design. They are relatively heavy parts assembled in ...
customer_reviews.text: After just a years light use, plastic parts that the motor and shredder blades are suspended from are breaking, just poor design. They are relatively heavy parts assembled in a plastic holder, there are just a few places where that holder is screwed into the inside of the top face that sits on top of the basket. The screws go through a relatively thin wall and they are pulling through...
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Hananel

customer_reviews.title: Awful shredder (read on, could be an outlier)
customer_reviews.text: Based on the rave reviews, I really wanted to love this shredder. But -- it's awful. That having been said, it could be a defective outlier. The issue: paper inserted into the shredder is pulled to the left as it goes through. This causes the paper to fold over and bunch up in the left corner. Plain and simple - have a look at the picture. It easily sliced through 1 sheet -- and was nice and quiet -- but it strained at 3 sheets though it's supposed to have a 6 sheet capacity.
customer_reviews.author: nayomie1

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This item is for our home use. It operates quietly which is a plus. The bin removal could be a bit easier. It's a bit difficult to remove and reinsert.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had one and it overheated and never started again. ...
customer_reviews.text: Had one and it overheated and never started again. Reordered another one and did not overheat but after emptying out the first load, just stopped working. Amazon just gives a 30 day return deadline, this one conked out in less than 3 months. Check carefully when Amazon gives a short return deadline !!!
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: 2-Stars Due to Amazon Sending Used Unit
customer_reviews.text: Please note the product itself seems to be excellent in having just tested it out. However, these 2* are attributed to Amazon for having sent a used unit when a *new* unit had been purchased. The unit was clearly in operation prior with shreds of paper hanging down all across the teeth. This has been happening all too often with Amazon pawning used products off as new. It really needs to stop. I find myself shopping at Target more each month the sloppier Amazon service gets.
customer_reviews.author: BTC

customer_reviews.title: works good
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described cuts paper into confetti basically.... i like how idiots complain about it appearing used and dont read on the packaging where it clearly says its tested in the factory to verify it works... ive had this for about 2 months now and it works fine... just make sure you buy the "shredder oil" otherwise it may wear out...
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Still working, but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shredder about 22 months ago. It still works, but the safety feature that stops it from running once there is no more paper going through it has given up. It just runs continuously. I have to switch it on for use, and then back off when I'm done or it will continue running until, I assume, it overheats. Otherwise, it functions as expected. It meets my needs; shredding junk mail, credit card offers, papers with sensitive personal information, etc. I wouldn't recommend it for any kind of business, though. The waste bin is pretty small and it overheats and shuts off if you have it running for more than 5 minutes or so.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon C.

customer_reviews.title: It shreds 6 sheets of the HP Paper Printer Premium 32 lb easily. Love it so far.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 8-Sheet High-Security *Micro-Cut* Shredder with Pullout Basket just few days ago. I haven't tested "a lot" but so far this shredder looks, works and shred easily 6-8 sheets of the HP Paper Printer Paper 8.5x11 Premium 32 lb. I purchased the other AmazonBasics 8-Sheet Capacity, <<Cross-Cut>> Paper and Credit Card Shredder, 4.1 Gallon, and I can tell you that if you are not shredding super important papers you can easily save half of the money by just purchasing the <<Cross-Cut>> version instead of the *Micro-Cut* Shredder. Something to keep in mind is that the <<Cross-Cut>> version does NOT shred those 8 HP 32LB paper sheets. Hope that help guys.
customer_reviews.author: JB DAUDINOT

customer_reviews.title: A Very Poor Investment
customer_reviews.text: This machine overheats very quickly and the "6-sheet capacity" claim is to say the least highly optimistic. I was shredding no more than 2 sheets at a time and when even that seemed to tax its capacity I reduced it to 1 sheet. It tends to jam easily and the shredded paper tends to collect in the mechanism necessitating frequent cleaning. An emphatic "NO" for me!
customer_reviews.author: Marquis15

customer_reviews.title: choppy
customer_reviews.text: what a great way to hide secret things! I am always worrying about people reading my mail or other important documents. This item is very helpful. It is very good at making very small cuts of paper. These cuts of paper can be used in many ways, confetti, box stuffing or fake snow. This shredder can shred more than one piece of paper at a time but it kind of slow. ... but not too slow, I would say. This shredder also fits very nicely in any office type space.
customer_reviews.author: SGHA

customer_reviews.title: Low  quality product
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect, but just one day. Then the engine didn't stop working even though all paper was shredded. Has to be turned off manually.
customer_reviews.author: DSD Brands

customer_reviews.title: Revised review...more positive
customer_reviews.text: I have been a PRIME member since 2005. Purchased this FIVE MONTHS AGO and it is dead already. I usually throw things like this in the trash if they die this quickly and do not contact the provider...i just avoid them in the future. But this time I contacted Amazon and was very happy. It turns out this Amazon basics product has ONE YEAR FREE REPLACEMENT as long as you return it for trouble shooting AFTER you get the free replacement. I was SHOCKED. I am changing my 1 star rating to 5 stars. This is true commitment to customers.
customer_reviews.author: Jamey

customer_reviews.title: two key features
customer_reviews.text: This may not seem like a big deal, but not having to lift the lid is a huge bonus for me. I have shoulder issues and lifting the heavy lid off my old shredder was difficult. This is SO EASY! You just pull out the bin from the front. Secondly, you can insert the papers at an angle, like sliding it it. If you are used to having to line up receipts and small papers straight up and down, this is a simple, yet efficient detail. Cut a whole bunch of things that I have been saving since my old one broke. Filled up a bucket and a half. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with a mind of its own
customer_reviews.text: Shredded 14 32-gallon bagsful of old documents intermittently over a 4-day period. When it over-heated, it simply stopped and would rest until it cooled down sufficiently to resume. Seemed to prefer 2-4 pieces of paper at one time; I rarely sent more thru the shredder. The pre-oiled sheets that can be purchased to keep the machine lubricated were very handy and intermittent oiling is necessary but, lacking those, a couple sheets ,oistened with olive oil did the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Tily

customer_reviews.title: Potential Fire Starter
customer_reviews.text: Similar issue to earlier review. Middle of the night woke up to running motor noise. The shredder, set on Auto, just began running. It probably had been running for quite some time before it was noticed. When I turned it off and started it again it would not run properly -- grating noise. There was nothing in the shredder to cause it to start. Could have started a fire from overheating.
customer_reviews.author: Torch

customer_reviews.title: Super Quiet Auto Shredder
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice size shredder that fits in my office easily. I love the fact that I can manually shred documents or stick up to 150 in the auto feeder. Compared to most shredders, this one isn't that loud. It does generate some noise as it has to operate, but it isn't obnoxious. The ONLY thing I dislike about this shredder is that you can't put a trash liner in the bin to catch the shreds. This means, I have to manually dump the shreds into a bag. (I can't do it without making a mess) Overall, I would recommend this shredder but suggest that Amazon adjust the design so that it can have a bag in the bin.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Super Quiet, though a bit on the slow side.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use once you get the hang of it. Using the feeder takes more time than loading sheets manually, but it's also nice to be able to just drop a stack of paper on it and come back to confetti 4 minutes later. This is one of the quietest units I've ever used before. Shreds into nice tiny little bits. Overall a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: McBriggie

customer_reviews.title: AmazonBasics 8-Sheet High-Security Micro-Cut Shredder - Purchase something else
customer_reviews.text: They don't tell you before you buy, but in the manual it says you have to unplug any time not in use. This means there's an electrical malfunction that they haven't resolved. It almost smells like something's burning when you use it, and I only used it a few minutes -- not long enough to overheat. Also, the pull out basket tends to get stuck a bit and you have to tap it back in to place. It would be a matter of time before the thin plastic would break. Poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: ETTN

customer_reviews.title: It’s Okay
customer_reviews.text: I shred my bills or credit card offers which usually come with 2-5 pieces of paper each. It’s annoying that I have to feed the shredder 1 piece of paper at a time. On a good day it might shred 2 at a time but eventually gets jammed up and I have to reverse and re-insert multiple times per sheet to get it through. It also gets stuck on credit cards being shredded. Oftentimes it requires 2-3 reverses before it’ll shred the whole card. I decided to ditch it when I moved and buy a new one that can shred at least 3 pieces of paper at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Hsu

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT value!
customer_reviews.text: My old shredder up & died; so I went looking for more security in a new shredder. I found this shredder, and I liked everything about it. When it arrived I put it thru the paces (an entire junk mail in envelope, 6 pages at a time, not real advertising credit cards to see what would happen). Everything was shredded into much tinier pieces than I had thought was possible. It is remarkably quiet, quick (unless you try to overload it). The security level 4 is really worth the money. Very tiny pieces that really protect you from Identify Theft.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Awsome shreder!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the old shredders that only cut one way, but rarely used it for fear of identity theft. So, we started saving and then burning old credit cards and docs with our important numbers on them. That was a pain! I finally caved and bought this one. I love it. It is fierce and makes tiny confetti out of everything! I will caution you to adhere to the directions about unplugging it when not in use. I make sure no critters , fingers, or clothing is by it when in use. I recommend this shredder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet!
customer_reviews.text: Really quiet, works exactly as described. I love the wheel feature; however, 4/5 stars given because it is top heavy and tips easily if not using two hands (one on each side of the shredder) when moving it. Something to weight the bottom to balance it would prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Manya

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few days
customer_reviews.text: This paper shredder is not worth the money. I understand this is a "budget" paper shredder but anything above 3 pages, it will jam. It overheats incredibly fast. If I need to shred 20 sheets of paper, I'll be lucky to make it past 12 sheets before waiting 45 minutes for it to cool down. The noise is incredibly loud. Once again, with this being a "budget" shredder, you get what you pay for. Couldn't handle those two problems so it's been returned.
customer_reviews.author: Alecs

customer_reviews.title: SHREDDER DIED IN LESS THAN A MONTH OF MODERATE USE.
customer_reviews.text: SHREDDER DIED IN LESS THAN A MONTH OF USE. I USED IT A COUPLE TIMES A WEEK. EVEN USED AmazonBasics Shredder Sharpening & Lubricant Sheets. NEVER PUT MORE THAN 4 SHEETS AT A TIME (SAYS IT WILL HANDLE 6 SHEETS). FOLLOWED ALL OF THE TROUBLE SHOOTING PROC. AND STILL DEAD. EVEN OPENED IT UP (5 small screws) TO CLEAN OUT THE UNDERSIDE OF THE CUTTERS-STILL NO GOOD. I WILL BE CONTACTING AMAZON ABOUT THIS ITEM!!!
customer_reviews.author: TIBBS

customer_reviews.title: Packaging improvement needed.
customer_reviews.text: Received this shredder and it's small and compact. The bin however was broken loose from the door, apparently from shipping damage, although there wasn't a lot of external box damage seen. I taped it back together and the shredder is working well for it's size, it a bit smaller than I had thought and about half the bin capacity as my previous Staples shredder I was replacing. It works pretty well otherwise, isn't to loud, just have to dump the bin more often.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Quit After 2 Years
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for just less than 2 years. It was used frequently but lightly enough to warrant emptying once every 4-8 weeks. My greatest disappointment is that it quit on me. I don't like having to repeat buying things. Other than that it was fine but I have mentioned a few points below. Prior to it breaking, I would have given it a 4.5-star. Now it occupies a 2-star status. It was quite noisy but didn't bother me. An annoying feature was in lifting the unit out of the bin it often collected large clumps of paper in the gears. It was especially messy to navigate. I'll hope to post a photo later demonstrating this.
customer_reviews.author: Ali S.

customer_reviews.title: zero stars not an option ;(
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last year in November based on all the glowing reviews... wish I had actually unboxed and used it right away -- because now I'm past the return date. Its nice and pretty -- but when you put a paper in it to shred - it sounds like the motor is spinning -- but the gears aren't turning the teeth.. About to void the warranty and try to repair myself before throwing into the landfill -- because that's all this is good for right now. Usually am very happy with the AmazonBasics products.. but this one is a serious dud. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tee Pasadena

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a paper shredder before, so, wasn't really sure what to look for and what to avoid. I like that this cuts the paper into smaller-than-pinky-fingernail pieces. You can hear the motor slow down a bit if you overload it, and, it does stop and show a red light when it begins to overheat. Regular staples are no problem and it can even take flat cardboard from cracker boxes, but, doesn't do well with paper napkins. The bin could be larger and as it fills to the top, you need to manually move the pieces around to prevent jamming. Nice household unit and I dump the pieces outside for mulch in the planting beds.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Bud

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a bargain, because it's a cheap device
customer_reviews.text: The rating is overly optimistic, at three sheets you can hear it would rather be working on only two at best. The auto-mode is problematic. As others have noticed it's a serious hazard that I suppose Amazon does not want to address. It will at some point decide to run indefinitely unless you turn it to off and only use auto when it's in service. And no, there is nothing stuck in there to cause the issue. Pay attention Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mikefeuer

customer_reviews.title: FELLOWS LOOK OUT.  THIS MAY PUT YOU OUT OF BUSINESS
customer_reviews.text: IVE USED FELLOWS FOR DECADES. DECIDED TO TRY THIS AFTER MY OLD FELLOWS SHREDDED CRAPPED OUT I LIKE THE FEATURES SUCH AS THE TILT OUT CHAD BIN SO YOU DONT HAVE TO LIFT THE SHREDDED HEAD OFF TO DUMP THE CONTENTS. BUT IT CANT HANDLE MORE THAN 3 SHEETS OF 20# COPY PAPER BEFORE CHUGGING A BIT. I FED ABOUT A HUNDRED SHEETS 3 AT A TIME AND IT NEVER OVERHEATED. THE BIN FULL DETECTOR TRIGGERS TOO SOON. THERES MORE ROOM IN THE BIN WHEN IT SHUTS OFF THE SHREDDER SO IT THIS LASTS 7 YEARS IT GETS AN A+
customer_reviews.author: Pen_Name

customer_reviews.title: Died in 4 months for no reason
customer_reviews.text: This seemed to work fine for about 3 months. It quit working today for no reason. I wasn't overloading it, wasn't using it for more than about 4 sheets of paper today before the mechanism that grabs the paper and simply stopped. All the paper cutter gears are still working, so I have no clue what may have happened. I checked the gears for anything odd -- its easy enough to pull out a few stray paper bits with a tweezer in case that someone caused something. But to no avail. I usually trust in Amazon Basics products, but this is a very short lifespan with no reason for breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Mary G,

customer_reviews.title: Bad shredder
customer_reviews.text: Not a good shredder. It jams really easy and we’ve only used it a few times and it not will no shred. It’s like people rob you of your money selling poorly made products!
customer_reviews.author: E. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Jamming and overheating.
customer_reviews.text: As the headline says this shredder has been jamming and overheating. As it feeds paper through it is pulled to the side which causes the constant jamming. It shuts down and the smell has me concerned that it is a fire hazard. Didn’t use it much initially and only became aware how bad it would be with more frequent usage recently; likely too late to return which I would for a better shredder. for sure.
customer_reviews.author: CalGal

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...
customer_reviews.text: I knew that it will stop when it overheats as a safety mechanism but it's inconvenient. I purchased some oil and sheets to keep it running smooth. We shred our junk mail..or at least the part where pre-approval cards are enclosed..to avoid identify theft. It really does shred into unrepairable pieces. It's ok for the money. We will see how long it holds up..Do recommend getting the oil...we didn't on our last shredder and it konked out early.
customer_reviews.author: DALADY

customer_reviews.title: It's so quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I have a much larger Fellows shredder that I've had for many years. It does not cut anywhere near as fine as this little Amazon, and makes a lot more noise. Longevity remains to be seen, but my first impression of this little shredder? I'm impressed! This is not for marathon shredding operation obviously. Just to drop one or two bills, it's perfect. Now if you're like me and you clean out your file drawers once every 10 years, you'll burn out this little guy. This is prefect for my wife, but I'll keep my big old trusty, noisy, less secure, work horse. If/when mine burns out, I'll have to spend a lot more on another work horse.
customer_reviews.author: Irwin Electronics

customer_reviews.title: What's Burning?
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for four days. I have been shredding paper on and off and it overheats almost instantly now. And as the video shows something is burning and smoking inside the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this POS
customer_reviews.text: I have had this shredder for ten months, moderate use. At first, it worked like a champ. But after nine months, the "auto" function stopped working. Now, at ten months, it has become a three-page shredder instead of handling six pages. It jams if I put in four pages.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Probably not as powerful as you need
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit conflicted with this. Honestly I regret I didn't get a better shredder. I do use it sparingly but even with 6 sheets it sounds like it's struggling. If you want to shred envelopes without even opening them you will need a better shredder. I had a lot of backed up documents to shred but I first got it and had to open up dozens of envelopes just to take out the important bits and shred them individually instead of just putting the entire envelope in there. Even for home office none-regular use this likely isn't good enough for most people.
customer_reviews.author: Onyx

customer_reviews.title: Shreds well often 3.7/5
customer_reviews.text: This 6 sheet shredder sheds well BUT... If you continuously shred 6 sheets in 2-3 mins, some of the sheets do not have the micro-cut, they seem to become cross cuts. The shredded pieces are quite large. They do not have a method of fixing this error because it actually might depend what paper weight you're using. It has worked quite well for shredding junk mail, and large envelopes as well as bubble wrap envelopes. Though I'd suggest not use the adhesive portion or peel that out. Make sure when you shred, you check the bin often because sometimes the paper will have a portion that might not actually get shredded much.
customer_reviews.author: Discount Student

customer_reviews.title: 1 year 7 months (lasted)
customer_reviews.text: I purchase this shredder because of the glowing reviews taking in the consideration of the negative ones. At first, the shredder worked without fail however as of recently it has started getting hot after continuous shredding at which time the machine needs time to cool, so we'd wait a day or more to shred again. When the blue bin fills up which is typically on Fridays I'd stay late to shred. Well, it died! The once capable shredder is horribly dead with four sheets stuck in the tray. I don't know why I thought better from Amazon. I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Latarsha

customer_reviews.title: Shredder
customer_reviews.text: Stop working after 6 months. Runs but does not shred. Have cleaned, oiled and tried to add paper to sharpen blades, still doesn't shred. I would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Sharold Graham

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: As much as I was looking forward to this shredder: it cross cut, it had an easy-to-remove basket for disposal and it was on wheel, I was disappointed as soon as I opened the box. The front portion of the shredded was completely broken off from the rest of the shredder. I'm not sure if this happened during packaging or transport, but it was a big disappointment (especially since I had a nice sized pile of mail I was waiting to shred once this arrived).
customer_reviews.author: Justin Harman

customer_reviews.title: For occasional shredding.
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is good When compared to its rivals around the same price range. It will overheat after a prolonged usage time. And you will notice the lack of power when you try to shred more than 3-4 sheets of paper. The more you try to shred at once (i.e., papers in stack) the quicker the shredder will overheat. It is however strong enough to shred a credit card (the plastic ones, not those cards which are made of metals). Lastly, the shredding wheel needs to be cleaned once in a while because papers pieces get stuck all over place.
customer_reviews.author: Curious George

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and perfect for my home office
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Shreds fast and efficiently - Quiet relative to other shredders I’ve owned - Big capacity! Cross cut let’s you fit more in the bin (if you open the bin and press down you can fit a bit more if you have a few more docs to shreds before you want to empty) Cons: - when it’s empty, it IS a little top-heavy so when rolling on its wheels it can have a slight chance of toppling. I don’t really move it much so not an issue for me. - can still make a small mess when you pull out the bin (just don’t let it fill all the way and take your time) Small gripe anyway
customer_reviews.author: Friendly and Objective Rob

customer_reviews.title: Value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I like the shredder. Good value for the money. Just use oil frequently and check often for jams as the paper will get stuck if it’s not allowed to fall freely into the bin. I empty it often , when bin is about 1/2 full . Run time is decent compared to similar products. For the money I believe it’s a good value. I unplug after use for safety reasons as this can be dangerous if not used properly.
customer_reviews.author: Happy

customer_reviews.title: Top Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Shredder works well, my problem with it is that the motor is too heavy for the rubber basket it sits on. It has fallen over several times from the slightest bump and spilled all over the floor. The worst thing is that it almost crushed my 8lb dog when it tipped over. It's really heavy. So I keep the top on the floor and just put it on when I use it. Also could put bricks in the basket but why should I have to balance out the flimsy rubber basket so it won't tip over? I had a similar shredder that came with a metal basket and it never tipped over. Skip buying this one unless you like vacuuming.
customer_reviews.author: AskFreedomFilerExpert.com

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but effective
customer_reviews.text: So IDK why but people still send me paper bills. I mark "electronic only" on everything but my mailbox is always full of paper bills, statements, and various other personal paperwork. I bought this shredder because my old one finally bit the big one. I am used to shredding paperwork while I watch TV, because it's super boring to shred paper. While this unit is effective at shredding and doesn't jam much at all, it's SO LOUD I can't hear the TV at all even with the volume at uncomfortably high levels. I only took off one star for that though, cause it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: DrowsyKitten

customer_reviews.title: 8 Sheets Is A Challenge....
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few weeks now and the 8-sheet capacity is a huge stretch. I usually send 4-6 sheets through at a time & it struggles with 6, gets very bogged down. I do like the micro-shred output for security, however be aware that the outer ends of the shredder blades often don't fully clear and every few shred sessions you'll need to unplug the shredder & grab the paper bits that are stuck. The bin is super easy to remove & empty at least, and the wheels are pretty stable. Bottom line: it's a cheap shredder that mostly does the job but doesn't quite live up to its advertised specs.
customer_reviews.author: cg3

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after only one use
customer_reviews.text: So, this stayed in my garage for a few weeks because of the lockdown. It worked great when I used it the first time, but I tried to use it again today and there is no power! I've not used in in about 3 weeks, so it could not be overheated and I have tried different outlets to no avail. This is actually the second one I purchased - the first one gave out as well after only a few uses
customer_reviews.author: floridienne

customer_reviews.title: Shreds like a boss
customer_reviews.text: After someone stole a month’s worth of recycling we bought this shredder. I don’t know why we didn’t do it any sooner. This thing shreds everything with ease, from carton, letters and old credit cards. The bin is big enough that you don’t have to empty it often.
customer_reviews.author: Rika

customer_reviews.title: Worked well until I shredded a credit card
customer_reviews.text: The shredder worked well for 18 months, until I shredded a credit card. The machine has a credit card slot, and successfully shredded the card, but afterwards never worked the same. It now has trouble grabbing the paper once sensed; I have to play with it for 20 or 30 seconds, trying different angles, until it finally grabs it and does its work. My theory is that the credit card shredding feature was designed for older credit cards, without embedded chips, and that the chip on today's credit card damaged the feeder mechanism. Not sure if that theory is accurate, and I'm not even 100% certain that it was the credit card that damaged the feeder, but the timing fits.
customer_reviews.author: David Bridgeland

customer_reviews.title: DID NOT WORK UPON ARRIVAL!!
customer_reviews.text: Received this shredder today and had to return it. After unboxing the shredder, I plugged it in and saw the overheat indicator was lit. The unit would not power on and the light did not go out. Upon further inspection of the packaging, I saw a "SAMPLE" sticker on the shipping box and a shipping label that was not removed from a previous address! Not good!!!🤔
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable
customer_reviews.text: I set this unit up as per the instructions, and tried shredding a few things as a test. Single sheets worked fine. But when I tried to shred an envelope with a letter inside -- a thickness much less than the 12-sheet maximum that was advertised -- the unit didn't just jam, it quit altogether. No forward, no backward, nothing. I tried turning it off and on again. Nothing. I tried unplugging it and then plugging it in again. Nothing. Very shoddy quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I like this shredder because it’s not as loud as my old similar model. It cuts everything up in very small pieces too. The only con I can find, and it’s minor, is that it’s a little top heavy and tips if you knock into it.
customer_reviews.author: pfjenny

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable but could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is a good size unit for home use and maybe light, at the desk use for business. I gave it 4 stars overall because it works and is fairly quiet as far as shredders go. My beef with this shredder is that the on /off switch is a slide type and is plastic. I think with any kind of moderate to heavy use this switch will fail. For the price, I would expect a better switch. The capacity is good and as i said previously it's reasonably quiet. Overall a nice unit with the exception of the switch and it could be priced $20 cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed dozens of shredders and decided on this one for daily home office shredding. I am not nice to the shredder and it's initiation task was to shred boxes of old tax records (oversized paper, metal staples, plastic cards). The shredder was on for hours a day for several days running. I would shove as many documents as I could shred for as long as I could go (until over heat), and repeat. Many times the shredder came to a halt and I had to reverse it as I overloaded it will paper. I expected failure, but it never failed and is still running smoothly for day to day shredding.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder
customer_reviews.text: I love that it cross shreds, and how many sheets at t time it can do. Wheels on the bottom makes it easy to move around. Only down size is when removing a full bin causes multiple pieces of paper to fall out and onto the ground. No big deal, just worth mentioning
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware....Used this product about 15 times since purchase and then it stopped working. At approximately $3 per use, this product is extremely expensive and a waste of your money. Due to this being an item used not very often in our home and the time elapsed since purchase, we have zero recourse and must purchase a new shredder unless amazon lets us ship it back and they send another product since ours was a lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic home office only use shredder
customer_reviews.text: Been using the shredder for a few weeks now. It's very quiet compared to my older Fellows shredder. Features and construction seem very nice for the price. The only downside is the motor. It's definitely on the weaker side and slows to a crawl with anything more than 3 sheets at a time. So far it has not bogged down to a stop, but you don't want to be routinely pushing more than 3-4 sheets of paper through this at a time, even though it's rated for 8 sheets. This is where the tradeoff comes in price vs. throughput. For light-duty home office use its great.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy This Shredder!
customer_reviews.text: This is the third one of these shredders that I’ve purchased over the last 3 and a half years. They last until a month or two after the warranty expires and then stop working. This shredder is supposed to handle 8 sheets. The most I’ve shredded at one time was five sheets. My current shredder jammed with just five sheets and then stopped working altogether. I’m going to buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Lillie

customer_reviews.title: Great Rolling Shredder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Mom who seems to jam every shredder she buys and pays good money for. I took a chance on the Amazon Basic Shredder Micro Cut with rollers and a pull out basket to make life easier for everyone who uses it. No more lifting a heavy top and maneuvering the bag to empty the basket. It rolls nicely except on carpet. I've used it with those junk credit cards in the slot shown on the front - no problem. So far, So Good!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home office
customer_reviews.text: With the covid-19 pandemic, my office is now in my home and it became necessary to obtain a paper shredder. I did not want a massive shredder. This one is perfect. It is mid sized, can shred up to 12 pages at a time and is relatively quiet (for a shredder that is). It has a bin that pulls out and can be emptied into the garbage. I like this feature as the shredders that make you pick up the shredding mechanism spill pieces of paper all over the place. The bin keeps the bits more contained and fewer pieces escape onto the floor.
customer_reviews.author: lmb

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Trash Can
customer_reviews.text: I am an average user of this shredder, typical shredding your daily mails and bills. I have this shredder for the year and a half and since the last six months, I saw machine struggling to shred. Finally, last week it justs stopped working. I bought it for over $40 with taxes and expected that with Amazon's name on it to work for a longer period of time. Also, the machine is load when shredding.
customer_reviews.author: HPRIDEMAGNA

customer_reviews.title: Great little shredder for home use
customer_reviews.text: Generally speaking, this shredder works great. I can only put 2-4 pages in at a time max, or they get stuck & it jams. One card at a time too. If you continuously use it for a long period of time, it gets overheated and will stop working. Once it cools, it’ll start working again. So don’t rush through your shredding and it does a great job of shredding. It’s about the size of a small trash can (next to a laser printer in photo to provide comparison). Everything shreds into confetti sized bits - so if you really want things destroyed, this shredder does it! (See photo to see shredded papers.)
customer_reviews.author: NYCUWS92

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I love the pull out draw feature as well as the wheels. Even though the the description states you can shred up to eight pages at a time, the max I did was six. It chomped through the pages with ease. The auto shutoff feature for the full bin and overheating is awesome. You will have a lot of dust residue if you have a lot to shred but that’s not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Duane A. Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have 20 years of my Mom's records to shred and my shredder bit the dust. I ordered this one for same day delivery and reviews were pretty good. I've only had it for a few days but it is great. It shreds into really small pieces and it's quieter than my last one. It cuts credit cards too! I have used it pretty heavily since it arrived and I don't have a negative thing to say. I have shredded a higher volume than I thought I could with this. It has not overheated. I do let it rest between filling up the container, but I am so impressed with it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Richards

customer_reviews.title: Does not last long
customer_reviews.text: My previous shredder latest many years of light use. Finally had to replace. Light use (<30 sheets/week). Regular maintenance and cleaning. Happy with this one for the first year, then it started to stall on 3 sheets (never did more), then after another 6 months I was down to one sheet at a time. After less than 2 years it now even does not do 1 sheet on its own, and I have to bang on it to finish. Not recommended
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dieces well but does not handle 6 pieces well
customer_reviews.text: Debating returning this product, it says it can handle six sheets of paper at a time but keeps jamming when I try. It also has no cover on the inside and has a reverse option, it's pretty intimidating to me as an adult let alone with kids around. And there is no lock to make it so the top can't come off. The shredding however when it doesn't jam does a great job breaking it down. It's just when you say your product can handle 6 pieces of paper it should be able to.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: I guess it is a sign of the times
customer_reviews.text: The last shredder I owned lasted over 16 years. But that was when companies took pride in their brand/product/name. It didn't stop every 3 minutes to cool off. It didn't keep you waiting 5 minutes until you could start it again. It did its job, it shredded paper. These prima-donna shredders these days are a disgrace, especially for the price. I have checked and the other shredders (regardless of manufacturer) function the same way. There is no pride left in Mudville.
customer_reviews.author: Trudye Nesbit

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: I really like that you can shred multiple sheets and that it shreds them to tiny pieces. The only issue is that when it starts to get full toward the top, it stops shredding mid sheet and it's a pain to reverse and try again. **UPDATE** I have had this now for almost a year and it still shreds very well. However, if it is set to "Auto", it will turn on randomly when no paper has been put in it and will run until you turn it off. I have to keep it off, now unless I am using it, for fear it will turn on in the middle of the night and overheat.
customer_reviews.author: Jen D

customer_reviews.title: Won't stop running in auto
customer_reviews.text: Can anybody help.. we got this in Feb of 2019... and it been pretty good.. we don't use it much... a couple sheets here and there and an infrequent purge of 20... now it wont stop running when its in auto...
customer_reviews.author: toni c.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far, this shredder is working very well - the noise level is quieter than our old shredder and it starts automatically when paper is inserted and ends automatically when the paper is shredded; it does several sheets very easily. However, our last shredder was an Amazon brand and the automatic start and stop didn't last long - the shredding was okay, but it was annoying to always have to be turning it on and off. On the new shredder, time will tell, but so far we like it.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shredder
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this shredder for light shredding of mail for last 5 years and it works like a charm. It's not too noisy and the small form factor lets it fit in the corner of my office without being an obstruction. Even if occasionally crossing the 6 sheet restriction it just blocks and lets you reverse and try again. During a longer shredding session (lots of paper) it did overheat once, but all it took was waiting until the overheat light turned off. The only issue I've encountered was with large envelopes, but technically it's not meant to shred anything larger than letter. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pawel

customer_reviews.title: Description of product is not reality
customer_reviews.text: I read all other reviews and understood the risks of purchasing this unit. However, my intent was secure shredding of documents and credit cards without paying a high price. I do not store my paperwork that needs to be shredded and instead shred as needed. I will restate that trying to continuously shred 6 pages at a time will result in it overheating within 5-6 minutes; therefore, I only shred 3 pages at a time. Amazon definitely needs to reevaluate their shredders and descriptions. This shredder is a great 3 page, occasion use shredder not a 6 page 3 minute continual use shredder.
customer_reviews.author: J & C Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Ya this is just a big version of the old slow piece of crap shredders and Amazon thinks it's worth over 100 bucks
customer_reviews.author: Cullin Pattillo

customer_reviews.title: Good, but maybe not the best choice for households with toddlers or pets
customer_reviews.text: The good: It is a nice, compact shredder that does what it is supposed to. The shredded pieces are tiny, little square about the size you get from a hole punch. It is fairly quiet - much quieter than the OmniTech shredder it replaced. The bad: There is no power light to indicate that the shredder is in the on position which is a pretty standard safety feature -- especially for any shredder used in a household with toddlers or pets. The input area has a safety cover, as it should, but having a power light as well would be better still.
customer_reviews.author: EMSinVA

customer_reviews.title: A great and economical choice for a home shredder.
customer_reviews.text: I shred old documents regularly for security reasons and this model adequately handles that task without much effort. Not needing to remove staples is a big advantage. Though I am gradually moving towards a paperless process forbthings traditionally done through printed copies, I'm not nearly there yet. I moved utility bills and most credit card and banking activity to online, but still occasionally print out a copy to use for verification or if I have a question of find an error. Eventually my shredding will be significantly reduced and I'm hoping this is the last shredder I'll need. Being able to shred credit cards is a good feature.
customer_reviews.author: michael mclaughlin

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BARGAIN SHREDDER
customer_reviews.text: Don't skip over this shredder because it is Amazon's brand. This shredder is worth its weight in gold. This performs and/or exceeds much more expensive shredders. This shredder literally turns paper into confetti. There is nothing to tape together. I was skeptical at first because it was an off-brand. But this has become the workhorse of my home office. I have successfully destroyed (receipts, old documents, forms with personal info, etc.) It is not very loud and takes up very little space. This is an excellent addition to any home office.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Burst into flames
customer_reviews.text: This Amazonbasics product burst into flames while I was shredding. It is quite amazing that I escaped injury. I bought it last May and it is not even a year old. I use in sporadically, say once or twice a month to shred about five pages total. It is not as if I had over-used it.
customer_reviews.author: Anushiya Ramaswamy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would be in love with a paper shredder but yet I am. This shredder is nothing short of amazing. You can load a large stack of papers into the hopper, turn it on and walk away. It is incredibly quiet and pretty fast. So much better than the manual feed shredders.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Farmer

customer_reviews.title: A Real and scary  Fire Hazard!!
customer_reviews.text: This shredder is a fire hazard. It caught fire in my office. Luckily, I had just emptied the shredded paper container just prior to it catching fire. It smoke up my home, but was lucky to put it out quickly. I always kept it clean and empty, thank God. If it had been full of tiny bits of paper, I am not sure I could have put it out quick enough. I was able to cover it and, put it out with a water hose in my back yard. No more AmazonBasics for me. Scary situation. I would highly recommend to not leave a paper shredder full of shredded paper. One never knows.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L

customer_reviews.title: Love micro cut
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I overpaid for the product but I do love the micro cut. When I remove a full bag of shredded material I do not like that when I take the basket out there are holes in the bottom of the device and sometimes the shreds stuck in the top fall out and go thru the holes and end up on my floor. I hate that. I wish the holes were not there. I love that it will tell me when it’s full and for the most part it works well. I believe I have shredded 12 pages at once and no issues occurred.
customer_reviews.author: Marvelous_M

customer_reviews.title: "Just Say'en"
customer_reviews.text: We had to return it exactly the same as our old 4 sheet cross cut which finally gave out....we never felt it was cracked up to what it was suppose to deliver, so we repurchased the 6 sheet. OMG! it wouldn't cut two sheets it would jamb, we actually put some examples back in the box to show "somebody" this product doesn't work either as advertised....never even tried 6 sheets it was nasty....Purchased a much better machine from a big box for the same money and it cuts 12 sheets like butter!!!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Broke down after 8 months of very light use * I do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: It was fine for 6 months then started acting up and today, after 8 months, it is refusing to accept even single pages. The rotator is not advancing the paper so it can be shredded. The only way I can get it to actually shread is to toggle back & forth between AUTO and REV. I am VERY VERY disappointed. My previous shredder lasted for about 7 years. ORIGINAL posting This machine makes confetti out of your documents. It is a little noisy and it gets rather warm if used continuously but it meets my day to day needs.
customer_reviews.author: OmniReader

customer_reviews.title: Decent shredder for SOHO
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 8 sheet because I needed the features not found in the 6 sheet (ability to shred staples, CD's, credit cards, etc) and this does all that just fine and the micro cut provides a level of security most people will find more than adequate. I knocked off a star because it appears rather cheaply made but at this price level that's not really unexpected. If I had it to do over again, I would opt for the 12 sheet simply for the larger bin.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart N. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Overheats and should be recalled
customer_reviews.text: My first review was cancelled, I assume because I included the URL to the CNN story where it talks about this product catching fire? Or maybe because I didn't talk sufficiently about how mine gets really REALLY hot when you use it. So I'm back, writing a review that hopefully meets the guidelines, to state how I am disappointed in Amazon for not recalling this dangerous product. I'll be replacing mine with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Shredder
customer_reviews.text: This shredder works well and is not that loud. I immediately threw about a hundred CDs at it and chewed through them well. It doesn't micro-cut them like it does paper, but they are in many pieces and definitely destroyed. Micro-cuts paper well, just abide by the directions and don't put in too many sheets at once.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Great shredder for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a shredder that not only sliced but diced too! This machine does just that with ease. I was wanting to add the shredded paper into my compost pile so I separate regular paper prom anything that won't break down easily and that cuts down on my trash I toss out. All in all I am very happy with this shredder and would suggest it to anyone wanting a decent machine for small jobs. I don't have piles of paper to shred so a 6 sheet machine is fine for me. If you have a lot of paper to shred you may want to look at a higher sheet capacity but this works fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: moberner

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous shredder
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find this product so inexpensive. Because I had owned a previous Amazon shredder... which I had used every day for years and years and finally burned out when I was shredding a rough draft of a 500 page novel... I decided that I would try this same brand again. I'm glad I did. It's quiet. Even better than the one I had prior. And the price is excellent. It also shreds up into tiny bits. Well done, Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Udana Power

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, great price!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would need a shredder. But now I'm convinced it's a good idea. I know I'm more likely to have a problem with data breaches or hacking, but this was a simple solution that I can handle, for all those ridiculous preapproved credit letters and even stupid blank checks. I called the credit card companies to stop that, but other stuff comes in the mail. Now I just shred it. I decided to spend the extra on the cross / micro cut. That is the way to go, and very affordable. Done!
customer_reviews.author: TerryU

customer_reviews.title: Surprise! Amazon Basics is the best shredder we've had!
customer_reviews.text: Have run it for 2 months in a home office. I shred one sheet at a time. I've done batches of 10-15 sheets, then turned off for 15 minutes. Quiet; doesn't clog; warning lights work when bin too full; easy to move around; micro cut. For the price, it is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: KOF

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 18 months and minimal use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 18 months ago. It appears it has a one-year warranty. It worked okay during the minimal usage I gave it, though it was fairly easy for it to overheat and require down time. Not it is smoking before it needs turned off. I threw it away. I would steer clear of this product...
customer_reviews.author: Meister

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics 8-Sheet High-Security Micro-Cut Shredder with Pullout Basket
product_meta.description: Size:8 Sheet| Pattern Name:ShredderAn amazon brand
feature_bullets: Micro-cut shred size: turns paper into tiny confetti-like pieces measuring 5/32 by 15/32 inches (4 by 12 mm); meets high security level P-4 standards; shreds 6X smaller than standard cross-cut shredders (2,235 pieces vs. 360 pieces)

Sheet capacity: shreds up to 8 sheets of 20-pound bond paper at a time (no need to remove staples or small paper clips); also destroys CDs, DVDs, and credit cards (one at a time, through dedicated slot)
Run time and thermal protection: 5 minutes on / 30 minutes off; if shredder runs continuously beyond the max run time, it will automatically shut off to protect the motor from overheating

User-friendly design: 4-mode power switch (auto, off, reverse, forward); LED status indicators (bin full, door open, overload, overheat, power on); 8.7-inch paper-entry width; easy-to-empty 4-gallon pull-out bin; casters included
Support and warranty: please refer to the user manual, troubleshooting guide, and instructional video before use; backed by an AmazonBasics 1-year limited warranty
Quality tested: as part of AmazonBasics quality inspections, we test every shredder before shipping it, which means you may see some paper shreds from the testing

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars6,585 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
